description: A pavilion inspired by the organic shapes of nature and the transformational potential of seeds, currently hosting the exhibition "Saving Seed". The walls can rotate position allowing the space to perform like a seed cracking open.

factsheet.heading: OmVed Gardens History
paragraphs: Since 2017 we have been carefully restoring previously tarmacked land in Highgate Village, north London, to provide a space for people to reconnect with nature through food, art and ecology.
Omved, a name drawn from the ancient echo of the vibration that created the world, inspires us to restore lost harmonies in ourselves and our environment, and to balance old and new wisdom.

factsheet.heading: Our Program
paragraphs: We focus on regeneration, creative exploration and inclusion, and food lies at the heart of our activities. It is a unifying necessity of life and a focal point in our quest to build a more conscious relationship with ourselves and the environment.

Our aim is to re-establish the connection between the urban population, food and nature, improve biodiversity at all levels - seed, food, species- and use creativity and nature-led knowledge to tackle the climate emergency.
Between April and October we curate a program of events and exhibitions about food, ecology and art and their interconnections.

factsheet.heading: The OmVed Gardens Chelsea Flower Show Pavilion
paragraphs: Designed by architectural atelier selgascano to host our garden exhibition "Saving Seed" at Chelsea Flower Show 2022, the pavilion was conceived to be relocated to OmVed Gardens thereafter to host other exhibitions and events.

factsheet.heading: Open House opening times, visiting circuit and special events
paragraphs: The Pavilion will be open to visits as part of Open House on the 16, 17 and 18 of September, 10-5pm, on a ticketed basis.
After visiting the pavilion, visitors can also take a peak through the gardens, designed by Paul Gazerwitz, and the glasshouse, restored by HASA architects.
To coincide with Open House, we plan to host three special architecture events every evening.
Visit our selgascano designed pavilion, awarded with a Silver Medal at the RHS Chelsea Flower Show 2022.

The pavilion has been created to reflect and melt into the OmVed Gardens landscape, designed by Paul Gazerwitz. Its innovative shape and features - including a transparent rooftop and a sinuous series of rotating walls that can be set into different positions - are inspired by the organic forms of nature and the transformational potential of seeds. The design was conceived as a flexible exhibition and events space that could host the exhibition at Chelsea Flower Show 2022 and later provide a new space for reflection, education and inspiration by the pond at OmVed Gardens.

Mounted on the walls of the pavilion, the exhibition showcases OmVed Gardensâ€™ regenerative growing and kitchen ethos, and presents data collected by their Seed Saving Network; a soundscape by wildlife sound recordist Chris Watson and audiovisual sound artist Julian Simmons; botanical illustrations by visual artist Maia Magoga; portraits of our enthusiastic community of seed savers by photographer Will Hearle; and a selection of articles about seeds and seed sovereignty published by OmVed Gardens magazine, Where the Leaves Fall.
Join architects selgascano and Paul Gazerwitz for a talk and Q&A about their work for the OmVed Gardens Pavilion and landscape.

The OmVed Gardens Pavilion was commissioned to Madrid-based architectural atelier selgascano to be conceived as a flexible exhibition and events space that could host an exhibition at Chelsea Flower Show 2022 and later provide a new space for reflection, education and inspiration by the pond at OmVed Gardens.

The design of the structure is inspired by the organic and dynamic forms of nature and the transformational potential of seeds. It also aims to reflect and melt into the OmVed Gardens landscape, designed by Paul Gazerwitz. Its innovative shape and features include a transparent rooftop supported by a sinuous series of rotating walls that can be set into different positions.
Get inspired by the OmVed Gardens pavilion, landscape and wild surroundings and join other sketchers to capture their colours and shapes.
Sketchers can drop in anytime throughout the opening hours (10am to 5pm).
Coloured pencils, papers and clippers will be available but we recommend bringing your own materials when possible.
We welcome people of all ages and levels of expertise and invite you to display your sketches on the walls of our exhibition space.
